entry.title: Federal Reserve Hikes Rate by 50bps, FOMC Signals Rate to Rise to 5.1% Next Year
entry.summary:
The U.S. central bankâ€™s Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) convened on Wednesday and raised the federal funds rate by 50 basis points (bps). The 0.5 percentage point rise follows the four consecutive three-quarters of a point increases codified during the last few months. The FOMCâ€™s rate hike follows the recent U.S. inflation report which indicated that consumer prices fell to 7.1%, which was lower than expectations.
Fed Raises Federal Funds Rate by 50bps, Central Bank Expects More Increases Going Forward
Following the consumer price index (CPI) report published on Tuesday, members of the U.S. Federal Reserve met on Wednesday and announced a 50bps rate hike. The December increase is smaller than the last four three-quarters of a point (75bps) rate increases.
â€œThe committee seeks toâ€¦

entry.title: NFT Sales This Week Jumped 27% Higher, Cryptopunks Rise Above Bored Apes
entry.summary:
On Dec. 14, 2022, statistics show that non-fungible token (NFT) sales jumped 27.72% higher than NFT sales recorded last week. The Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) NFT collection captured the most sales this week but on Wednesday afternoon, the floor value tied to Cryptopunks once again jumped above the floor value associated with the BAYC NFT collection.
$154 Million in NFT Sales Recorded Over the Last Week, Cryptopunksâ€™ Floor Values Rise
From last Wednesday up until today, $154.78 million in sales were recorded over the last seven days which is 27.72% higher than the week prior. The $154 million in NFT sales over the last week came from 184,248 NFT buyers and 886,605 blockchain transactions according to cryptoslam.io metrics.
Once again Ethereum NFT sales dominate as the chain saw $129â€¦

entry.title: Visiting El Salvadorâ€™s Slums, Itâ€™s Clear Bitcoin Country Must Go Further
entry.summary: A visit to Soyapango, one of El Salvadorâ€™s most impoverished slums, shows that the Bitcoin experiment isnâ€™t reaching those who need it most. This is an opinion editorial by Rikki, author and co-host of the â€œBitcoin Italia,â€ and â€œStupefattiâ€ podcasts. He is one half of the Bitcoin Explorers, along with Laura, who chronicle Bitcoin adoption around the world, one country at a time. A few days before this writing, El Salvador's president Nayib Bukele announced an immense police operation. San Salvador's satellite city of Soyapango was surrounded by 8,500 military and 1,500 police officers, who went searching from house to house for gang members still hiding in the area. More than 150 arrests were counted. Soyapango represents one of the most difficult realities for the country. With 300,000 inâ€¦

entry.title: Ethereumâ€™s Diverse Ecosystem â€” How Has It Changed In 2022?
entry.summary:
Data shows some shifts have taken place in the Ethereum ecosystem this year. Hereâ€™s how the shares of some popular transaction types have changed on the network in 2022.
Both DeFi And NFTs Have Taken A Hit In Dominance On Ethereum
As per the latest weekly report from Glassnode, the DeFi and NFT sectors both have similar dominance on the Ethereum blockchain now. The â€œdominanceâ€ here refers to the percentage of the total Ethereum gas usage that a particular transaction type is contributing to at the moment.
The ETH network hosts a very diverse ecosystem of applications made possible thanks to the smart contracts mechanism of the blockchain. Some of the popular constructs that have found a home on the network include non-fungible tokens (NFTs), decentralized finance (DeFi) applications,â€¦

entry.title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren Introduces Sweeping Anti-Privacy, Anti-Freedom Bitcoin Bill
entry.summary: U.S. Senators have introduced a bill that would have a direct impact on the categorization and regulation of bitcoin miners, wallets and nodes. Senators Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass) and Senator Roger Marshall (R-Kan) have introduced the â€œDigital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Act Of 2022,â€ a bill which would have sweeping impacts on the privacy of bitcoin users. If enacted, the bill would require custodial and self-custodial wallet providers and miners to implement know-your-customer (KYC) systems. It would also prohibit financial institutions from interacting with privacy tools such as CoinJoin in an effort to limit the ability of users to maintain their privacy. While the bill focuses on such measures in order to curb money laundering, tools such as CoinJoin simply restore the usersâ€™ ability tâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: SOL Hits 3-Week High, as ADA Consolidates Ahead of FOMC Meeting
entry.summary:
Solana surged to a three-week high ahead of this afternoonâ€™s Federal Open Market Committee meeting (FOMC). The token rose for a second consecutive day, hitting a key price ceiling in the process. Cardano mainly consolidated on Wednesday, as prices fell from a recent high.
Solana (SOL)
Solana (SOL) was a notable gainer on Wednesday, as prices surged to a three-week high.
Following a low of $13.61 on Tuesday, SOL/USD raced to an intraday high of $14.68 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
As a result, solana moved to its strongest point since November 26, which is the last time prices were trading above a key ceiling of $14.70.
Looking at the chart, this resistance point has yet to be broken following todayâ€™s gains, with SOL trading at $14.67 as of writing.
The 14-day relative strength index (RSI) also rose, and is currently tracking at 48.36, however it also failed to break out of a resistance level.
As of writing, the index remains below a ceiling of 49.00, which appears to be the main obstacle in place, preventing any further surges.
Cardano (ADA)
On the other hand, cardano (ADA) moved away from a recent eight-day high, as price consolidated ahead of todayâ€™s FOMC meeting.
ADA/USD fell to a low of $0.3069 earlier in the day, which comes less than a day after hitting a peak at $0.3152.
This surge in price sent cardano to its strongest point since December 5, which is the last time price was above a ceiling of $0.3270.
From the chart, it can be seen that todayâ€™s price consolidation began following a failed breakout of the 46.00 ceiling on the RSI indicator.
Currently, the index is tracking at 43.79, with momentum appearing to be heading for a floor at 37.60.
Should price strength reach this point, it is likely that ADA will be trading close to the $0.3000 support level.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect cardano to rally following todayâ€™s interest rate decision? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Bulls Take The Lead As Bitcoin Investor Sentiment Recovers
entry.summary:
Bitcoin investor sentiment had wavered following the implosion of the FTX crypto exchange. This had sent market sentiment to one of its lowest points for the year 2022, falling deep into the â€˜Extreme Fearâ€™ territory. However, as the market has recovered with time, investors in the space have been able to take stock of losses and readjust, with the positive CPI report boosting the faith in the market. Now, sentiment has seen a marked uptick as bulls become stronger.
Bitcoin Investors Leave Extreme Fear Behind
Over the last couple of days, bitcoin investor sentiment had been steadily improving. Data from the Fear & Greed Index shows that while the market finished last month in extreme fear, the new month has seen better levels. A six-point increase from Novemberâ€™s 24 has put the index atâ€¦

entry.title: From A Penthouse To No Bed: FTX Founder Sent to Prison Unfit for Humanity
entry.summary:
The co-founder and former CEO at failed crypto exchange FTX, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), was taken into custody by Bahamian authorities. According to recent reports, SBF was taken to one of the worst prisons in the world, called Fox Hill.Â
The correctional facility has a reputation for its lack of hygiene, high risk of contracting diseases, rodent infestations, violence, and more. The former FTX CEO was arrested for his alleged participation in the downfall of his company. Customers lose billions in deposits.
Sam Bankman-Fried could face up to 115 years in prison if heâ€™s convicted on all eight charges filed by the Department of Justice on Tuesday. (Bloomberg)
â€” Tiffany Fong (@TiffanyFong_) December 14, 2022Â
FTX Founder Could Spend Life In Top Five Worst Prisons Worldwide
Bitcoiâ€¦

The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's businessâ€”plus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what heâ€™s looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Tornado Cash Sanctions, Ethereum Merge, DAOs and NFTs at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: In an extensive talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Decrypt in Napa CA in October, Edward Snowden gave his candid views on the Ethereum merge, the sanctioning of Ethereum mixer Tornado Cash by the U.S. government, the privacy shortcomings of Bitcoin and Ethereum, and his view on using DAOs to source tips from whistleblowers.

entry.title: The New Landscape for NFT Drops: Bad Grrls Creative Club, BeetsDAO, and Cymbal at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Amid a crypto bear market and recent declines in NFT sales volume, what's the new roadmap for new NFT collections? What's expected by community members and collectors? Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club, Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO, and Eric Feng of NFT block explorer discussed with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Camp Decrypt Napa.

entry.title: Musician 3LAU on His Music NFT Platform Royal: 'We Take Compliance Really Seriously'
entry.summary: Justin Blau aka 3LAU, CEO of Royal, talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about building his company around compliance from the start. "We take compliance so seriously that it might make us move a little bit slower... but we think that's really how we have to build in the space." He also said he looks to Coinbase as a model.

entry.title: FTX Meltdown 101: What the Hell Happened and What Comes Next
entry.summary: In less than a week, one of the largest and most trusted crypto exchanges went up in flames, along with its crypto celebrity founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Kate Irwin walk you through exactly how it happened, what it means for you, their own takes on the most interesting subplots, and what we can learn from it all. Plus: We review some comments SBF and CZ made on this podcast that look remarkable in hindsight. Watch Episode 23 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Sun On the Future of Tron's USDD Stablecoin
entry.summary: The Tron founder tells Decrypt about the network's decentralized stablecoin USDD, and how Tron aims to "bridge the Web3 world with the real world.
